alert.note: Alert for Greer; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 3:57PM CDT until August 09 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Oklahoma and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southwest Oklahoma, Greer. In western Oklahoma, Beckham and Roger Mills. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in localized areas between Sweetwater and the Texas state line. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elk City, Sayre, Cheyenne, Erick, Hammon, Carter, Reydon, Sweetwater, Strong City, Texola, Delhi, Berlin and Dempsey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
